TEXT.TITLE: AUSTRALIAN CRUDE OUTPUT FALLS IN FIRST NINE MONTHS
TEXT.BODY: Australian crude oil and condensate output fell 7.6 pct to 23,480 megalitres, or about 147 mln barrels, in the first nine months of fiscal 1986/87 ending June 30, the Department of Resources and Energy said. The decline in production in the nine months to end-March reflected mainly a sharp dip early in the fiscal year, when low oil prices and high marginal excise rates led to a reduction of output from Bass Strait, department figures in its Major Energy Statistics publication show. A megalitre is 6,290 barrels. REUTER
